___field.description: The field name to aggregate over.

___op.description: The field name to aggregate over.

___format.description: The formatting pattern for text value. If not undefined, this will be determined by small/largeNumberFormat and the max value of the field.

___useRawDomain.description: Use the raw data range as scale domain instead of aggregated data for aggregate axis. This option does not work with sum or count aggregateas they might have a substantially larger scale range.By default, use value from config.useRawDomain.

___field.description: The field name to aggregate over.

___op.description: The field name to aggregate over.

___titleOffset.description: A title offset value for the axis.

___labelAngle.description: Angle by which to rotate labels. Set to 0 to force horizontal.

___orient.description: The orientation of the axis. One of top, bottom, left or right. The orientation can be used to further specialize the axis type (e.g., a y axis oriented for the right edge of the chart).

___grid.description: A flag indicate if gridlines should be created in addition to ticks. If `grid` is unspecified, the default value is `true` for ROW and COL. For X and Y, the default value is `true` for quantitative and time fields and `false` otherwise.

___format.description: The formatting pattern for axis labels. If not undefined, this will be determined by small/largeNumberFormat and the max value of the field.

___maxLabelLength.description: Truncate labels that are too long.

___ticks.description: A desired number of ticks, for axes visualizing quantitative scales. The resulting number may be different so that values are "nice" (multiples of 2, 5, 10) and lie within the underlying scale's range.

___layer.description: A string indicating if the axis (and any gridlines) should be placed above or below the data marks. One of "front" (default) or "back".

___title.description: A title for the axis. (Shows field name and its function by default.)

___titleMaxLength.description: Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the field's description

___field.description: The field name to aggregate over.

___op.description: The field name to aggregate over.

___orient.description: The orientation of the legend. One of "left" or "right". This determines how the legend is positioned within the scene. The default is "right".

___title.description: A title for the legend. (Shows field name and its function by default.)

___filled.description: Whether the shape's color should be used as fill color instead of stroke color.

___ordinalPalette.description: Color palette to encode ordinal variables.

___range.description: Color palette, if undefined vega-lite will use data propertyto pick one from c10palette, c20palette, or ordinalPalette.

___quantitativeRange.description: Color range to encode quantitative variables.

___value.description: Color to be used for marks.

___stack.description: Enable stacking (for bar and area marks only).

___reverse.description: Whether to reverse the stack's sortby.

___field.description: The field name to aggregate over.

___op.description: The field name to aggregate over.

___titleOffset.description: A title offset value for the axis.

___labelAngle.description: Angle by which to rotate labels. Set to 0 to force horizontal.

___orient.description: The orientation of the axis. One of top, bottom, left or right. The orientation can be used to further specialize the axis type (e.g., a y axis oriented for the right edge of the chart).

___grid.description: A flag indicate if gridlines should be created in addition to ticks. If `grid` is unspecified, the default value is `true` for ROW and COL. For X and Y, the default value is `true` for quantitative and time fields and `false` otherwise.

___format.description: The formatting pattern for axis labels. If not undefined, this will be determined by small/largeNumberFormat and the max value of the field.

___maxLabelLength.description: Truncate labels that are too long.

___ticks.description: A desired number of ticks, for axes visualizing quantitative scales. The resulting number may be different so that values are "nice" (multiples of 2, 5, 10) and lie within the underlying scale's range.

___layer.description: A string indicating if the axis (and any gridlines) should be placed above or below the data marks. One of "front" (default) or "back".

___title.description: A title for the axis. (Shows field name and its function by default.)

___titleMaxLength.description: Max length for axis title if the title is automatically generated from the field's description

___dayScaleLabel.description: Axis labels for day of week, starting from Sunday.(Consistent with Javascript -- See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Date/getDay.

___maxSmallNumber.description: maximum number that a field will be considered smallNumber.Used for axis labelling.

___useRawDomain.description: Use the raw data range as scale domain instead of aggregated data for aggregate axis. This option does not work with sum or count aggregateas they might have a substantially larger scale range.By default, use value from config.useRawDomain.

___largeNumberFormat.description: D3 Number format for axis labels and text tables for number > maxSmallNumber.

___smallNumberFormat.description: D3 Number format for axis labels and text tables for number <= maxSmallNumber. Used for axis labelling.

___timeScaleLabelLength.description: Max length for values in dayScaleLabel and monthScaleLabel.  Zero means using full names in dayScaleLabel/monthScaleLabel.

___formulas.description: Array of formula transforms. Formulas are applied before filter.

___field.description: The property name in which to store the computed formula value.

___expr.description: A string containing an expression for the formula. Use the variable `datum` to to refer to the current data object.

___filter.description: A string containing the filter Vega expression. Use `datum` to refer to the current data object.

___values.description: Pass array of objects instead of a url to a file.
